title: midi recording
content: I've done a bit of searching on Google, haven't been able to find anything so I guess I'll ask you guys.  Anyone know of a program that allows you to fake or simulate a MIDI keyboard input and just play on your computer keyboard or something, so that you can record MIDI into a program like Cubase or Pro Tools?[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: midi recording
content:
Nice, this could be useful...

I have my MIDI keyboard connected to my PC, but there's some mysterious lag when pressing notes, so this could come in useful for parts of a song that are difficult to do with a lag.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: midi recording
content: Thanks, that seems to be exactly what I need![url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: midi recording
content:
What are you up to, xtra? Electronic music? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: midi recording
content:
Hehe, that's my plan. Unfortunately, I lack the money for an actual keyboard, so this'll have to substitute.

For those interested in using the program grafix found, you'll need to install a virtual MIDI port as well, I found one that seems to work here: [url=http://www.sharewareconnection.com/loopbe1.htm]www.sharewareconnection.com/loopbe1.htm[/url][url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: midi recording
content:
That's cool. I'm a bit interested in it again myself, so I might return working on stuff one day. Although I've never used MIDI. Anyways, I thought you weren't into electronic, but of course my memory isn't that good anymore and one's interests can change during the years. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke.gif[/img] Do you have any genre or style in mind? Good luck.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: midi recording
content: I've always liked electronic, artists like The Crystal Method, Infected Mushroom, Astrix, etc.. I don't have any specific goal in mind, I'm just going to record and see what comes out :P[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]
